intro: Pedicularis brachyodonta subsp. grisebachii, commonly known as the gray-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a dense layer of grayish pubescence. The species is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
